intro: Avena spiciformis, commonly known as the spicate oat, is a grass species native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and spike-like inflorescence composed of dense, spikelet clusters. The plant produces small, two-lobed flowers that are typically greenish-brown in color. Avena spiciformis thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and slopes. Its fibrous roots help stabilize soil, making it an important plant in ecological restoration efforts.
